Plot: Asterix and Obelix visit a village split in half by its rival chiefs. However, one chief's son and the other's daughter are in love, and together with Asterix and Obelix, they reunite the village.

Getafix has run out of rock oil and sends Asterix and Obelix to Mesopotamia in search of it. They are accompanied by a Gaulish-Roman druid called Dubbelosix, who is really a double agent seeking to foul their mission.
A baby boy mysteriously turns up at Asterix's doorstep. No one in the village knows who he is, so Asterix is forced to be his adoptive father.
A fakir from far-away India travels to Asterix's village and asks Cacofonix to save his land from drought since his singing can cause rain.
A feminist satire in which a female bard called Bravura replaces Cacofonix as school teacher and %INLINEQ%liberates%INLINEQ% the village women, causing the men to leave and live in the forest.

English Title: Asterix and Obelix All at Sea
Plot: Left alone in Getafix's hut, Obelix drinks a cauldron of magic potion. He first turns to stone, then into a small boy.
A Roman actress poses as Panacea in order to steal back a fancy sword/scabbard and helmet belonging to Pompey, which Asterix and Obelix received for their shared birthday.

French Title: Le ciel lui tombe sur la tête
Plot: Rival aliens visit the Gaulish village in search of the Gaul's great weapon, which is %INLINEQ%known throughout the universe%INLINEQ%. The aliens battle each other, and the magic potion later proves to have an unexpected side-effect on them.
